reviewText: This book has beautiful photos, good and understandable directions, and many different kinds of jewelry.  Wire working and metalsmithing jewelry are covered.  Highly recommend this book.
I love the ideas but have no access sea glass, but will experiment with other stones ... but I do love the book.  Great job!
summary: makes you want to live by the sea...

reviewText:
As someone who has never possessed the manual dexterity or patience for creating jewelry, I think that I could actually make something after reading this new book.

The book is bursting with exceptional up-close photography which walks you easily through each process.  The explanations of basic tools and techniques are written clearly and for those without any jewelry making experience, it all makes sense!  Once you learn the how tos of working with different organic elements, the book teaches you numerous beginner and intermediate projects. Again, the photography is exceptional and the instructions easy to understand.

If you've had the desire to learn jewelry making, especially using sea glass or other natural elements,  I highly recommend this book to you!
summary: Highly Recommend this Jewelry Making Book

reviewText: beautiful layout and fun pictures. as a collector of beach glass it is great to see other ways to use it beside a mason jar in the window.

Some days ago I received my fabulous book: Organic Wire and Metal Jewelry. I'm in love with my book. Love the pictures and the instructions are simple and clear. I loved all the projects and I'm sure everyone who has purchased the book. think like me.
Excellent! It was just what I was looking for. Great service too! Thank you very much for the great experience!
Loved their approach in this book and that it was a "paperback".  Easy to use and inspiring me to use up my beachcombing finds.
Well written and beautifully illustrated.  Features unique designs using gemstones and/or beach glass. A definite must have for anyone looking for new designs and different mediums to work with.
summary: Beach Glass and Wire Jewelry - what a bonus!

reviewText: I highly recommend this book.  It's written for those new to the craft of jewelry making and those with more experience who want to expand their skill set. I have some jewelry making experience and consider my skills intermediate to advanced, and I'm pleased to say this book is now on my book shelf.  Beth Martin and Eva Sherman are excellent teachers and it comes through in this book.  They take you from the fundamentals of tools and material choices,to technique basics of a wrapped loop,to texturing,and even the use of a torch.  The instructions are clearly written and easy to follow. The projects are beautiful and will offer a chance for those new to jewelry making to expand on the skills you learn as you move from what they designate as beginner to intermediate.  Great purchase!
summary: Excellent addition to the jewelry maker's book shelf!

reviewText: This beautifully photographed book provides step-by-step instruction from beginner level to more advanced projects in hand-crafted jewelry using sea glass, stones, and crystals. Having admired and worn Beth Martin's jewelry crafted from sea glass found along the shores of Lake Erie, I thoroughly enjoyed reading about the materials, tools, and skills that combine to make stunning, one-of-a-kind wearable art. This book has everything the beginner needs to produce lovely pieces, and, with 50 different projects, it offers ideas and inspiration for the seasoned and skilled jewelry designer as well.
great
Great book. Lots of great projects and easy to follow instructions. Great price also.
It's O.K.

Fantastic book - good directions, good projects.  The only recommendation I can offer is that some of the pictures are "reversed" to the directions so it just requires a bit of study and "recalculation" to reconcile the two; otherwise, wonderful book!

I like cold connections, so I'm constantly in search of books that demo connections without solder.  What a wonderful surprise! When I saw the cover, I wasn't sure if I was going to like the designs.  Well, I found this book amazing!  Contains some really nice designs and techniques are shown.  Yeah, there are few times when a torch is used, but for the most part, many of the designs don't require heat.  For that, I am thankful.
Always love the way Eva thinks, and there are some fun designs in this book. Easy to advanced for all. Fast shipping.
Nice patterns
love the spirit of the book and some of the projects.
just what I wanted

summary: The designs are wonderful, but what I consider even better are the ...

reviewText: Not a fan. Limited designs. Limited content for the money

If you're an experienced wire jewelry maker, there's not much new to be found in this book. There are a few clever ideas, but overall, the look of the projects is pretty amateurish. "Stunning", is an overstatement.
A very good book.  I loved the projects in the book and it inspired me to create some new designs.  I would definitely recommend it.

Hi, have been making jewelry now for the last 5 years and love the use of nature and using natural materials.  The cuff bracelet uses a lot of wire; however, the outcome is beautiful.  Especially if you patina the copper with antique black and tumble it for 30 minutes or so afterwards.

There's nothing prissy or matchy-matchy about the designs in this book.  The authors have presented jewelry that appears to have sprung full-grown from the earth, sea, and/or sky.  I was inspired by nearly every page.

I've been fortunate to have taken classes with Eva, and if you have the opportunity I urge you to do the same.
Great projects that I'll be able to personalize for any occasion. The only thing better than the instruction in this book is to be in one of Eva's classes--she's a wonderful teacher.
summary: Wonderful projects by a great teacher!

reviewText:

reviewText:
Just love this series, and the catch ups with the previous character just love it.
It a good love story

I wanted to LOVE this book but it wasn't quite the home run I'd hoped it would be.  It has a great solid story and I did love the crossover of characters with those from the author's sisters books.  What didn't quite live up to my expectations where the characters.  Brice is an ass, plain and simple. He may have a past that has shaped him into that but I just couldn't warm up to him.  While I liked Lena, the fact that she doesn't call Brice on his crappy behavior drove me nuts.  The other thing that had me a bit crazy was the fact that these two couldn't seem to just sit down and have a conversation.  Avoidance on both their parts just made things worse than they needed to be.

As I stated though it does have a good story and because I have enjoyed all the other books from this author I will definitely be reading the next in this series.  Hopefully those characters won't have me yelling at the book.
summary: I wanted to LOVE this book but it wasn't quite the home run ...

reviewText: This was really a good story.  Only gave it 4 of 5 stars because I really didn't like Brice.  Story was entertaining but needed more depth from him for me to give it a 5.  Perhaps I will get the "more" as the series continues.  What was so horrible about the grandmother?  Why did the mother go & where?  What did the father finally say during his night of confessions?  Yes, I want to read more in the series.

Brice Henderson friend and business partner to Asher Barrington has always been a go getter so when his latest project was the one that could get him recognized his talent, he went all out. But what Brice didn't count on was a face from the past turning his world upside down.

Lena Razzi a single mother to a little boy named Nicholas got a job as a replacement for a month at B&H Advanced Engineering but what she was not told was that she would be working for an old flame....the one and only, Brice Henderson.

When Lena and Brice came face to face it was a surprise to them both, the chemistry and attraction were still very much alive....The former still loved the latter ans vice versa, they were both trying to stay away but to no avail.

Lena never told Brice about Nicholas cause she never wanted her son to feel rejected by his father. But when Brice found out about his existence, he regretted the choices he made in the past....Choosing success over family and relations.

There was no turning back the hands of time only looking forward to the future with Lena and Nicholas. ONE WHITE LIE was fascinating. Love Dominic Corisi, Trent and many more making an appearance.

This is my first book by Jeannette Winters, I'm thrilled that she's working with one of my favorite authors, Ruth Caredello and I can't wait for what they have in store for us with this amazing series.

This book was a solid 4 stars for me. I did not forsee Brice having the attitude and determination of his partner Asher. When I first met him in Always Mine, I thought he was the gentler of the two. HEY, I was SO wrong. Him and Lena relationship or reunited one was tricky. Things ended confussed and hurtful on her part but she never got over the person she once knew. As they say all people change and Brice's change was not for the better.

It took long nights in a hospital room after some mixed feeling news and a meddling sister for him to learn the truth about Lena. Also, it took clearing a soul before death for him to get closure that held him in a place of stay and go, love from a distance or by her side. I am glad he made the right choice and am excited to see what lies ahead for the other Henderson clan.

As always Jeannette is so wonderful. This story was breath taking. It just keeps you wanting more. I mean who doesn't like two past lovers reuniting trying to fight the urge they have for each other. I would say I wish this would happen to me, but I am glad my ex's are my ex's. If this is how the first book in her brand new series starts, I can't wait to read the rest of this series.
summary: A new series, another great read

This is a poorly written and extremely predictable book with characters that I couldn't stand.  Lena Razzi was dumped by her boyfriend on the evening that she intended to tell him that she was pregnant.  So, for three years she has had to go it alone and provide for her 2 1/2 year old son by herself.  She gets a sudden call from a temporary agency to replace "Mr. Henderson's" personal assistant.  She submits her resume, has an over the phone interview and is hired to start immediately.  (Yeah, like big shot company owners would let this happen.  Hah!)  The first morning she walks into the office and...TA-DAH...there is her former lover and father of her child.  He is NOT happy to see her and demands that she leave.  She talks him into giving her a trial run.  One week later she goes into his office and they strip off their clothes and have hot sex.  Hmm.  See how this is going?  It doesn't get any better...or any more believable or any more interesting, either.

Most of this book is made up of characters talking to themselves.  I don't mind a little of that but page after page after page is mind-numbing.  I started counting pages (yeah, you can see how interested I was in this story!) and there would be 4 or 5 pages of this before you would get any dialogue.  The hero(?) was a total a**hole.  He treated his family like crap, all the while complaining about what a heartless bas***d his father was.  The heroine was supposed to be a self-sufficient woman who was only interested in taking care of her son, but turned into mush every time this jerk touched her.  I disliked her as much as I did him.  I'm quite sure that their HEA is only temporary.

Sexual situations may offend some readers

reviewText:

While Brice was an arrogant jerk, he also saw his faults and took responsibility for his behavior. I didn't blame Lena for what she did.... Brice made it clear to her that his 'future' was all that counted and no room for her in it. So, I never saw what Lena did as a 'white lie'.... not when you replay Brice's words to her. She really didn't have much of a choice.

Lena is a single mom who becomes a fill-in personal assistant for  Brice. Both are surprised as they are past. Lovers and her son is his son!  Brice had a really tough family life, as his father was abusive. Consequently he feels unworthy of love, and unable to show love and be a good father. As a result, he does not allow relationships to grow serious. The story is not that hard to figure out, but the relationship between father and son is really and his father explains things about his grandmother and his mother. These are really not explained so that the reader understands underlying causes of his father and mothers relationship or if the mom is even still alive. Those were real empty spots in this story. There was too much head speaking happening. I was waiting for solution of the family issues and that was left unresolved. Also he wasn't believing in his worthiness, and she was convinced he would leave her again. Yet both turned on a dime when the time came. I would have liked more time explaining why he left her originally, and what happened to his dad and why, as well as if mom is still alive and can be a positive influence on her kids.

I gave it 4 stars as I could not put myself in such a,lifestyle

One White Lie is a "love interrupted" and "secret baby" romance. I personally find it hard to accept why woman would just walk away and keep the baby a secret from the father even if he had wrong her, but that's just my personal opinion. Still, this story, while polished, just didn't grab me.

Brice Henderson broke away from his controlling father to make his own fortune, by sacrificing everything, including the one woman he loved, but he can afford no distractions. When his personal assistant needed to take sick leave to take care of family, Brice reluctantly agreed to hire a temporary replacement... who turned out to be the one woman he pushed away... Lena Razzi. Lena spent years trying to forget Brice, despite having a daily reminder... a son by Brice that not even Brice knew about. Lena needed the job, even if it's just a temporary gig, to take care of the baby and herself, and Brice hasn't changed. But as they spent more time together, neither can forget the good times they once had. Can Lena tell Brice about their son if she's not staying? Can they rekindle their love... Or was this going to be a flash in the pan like last time?

Frankly, I am tired of books that tout doormat single mom keeping the baby secret as if to spite the (bleep) dad just to prove you don't mean anything to me except as sperm donor, but as soon as they see each other, they got back together. It's basically formula that she won't tell him, believing this second time is temporary as well, then he found out and was pissed off, or he think he's damaged and was too good for her, or vice versa... But eventually they got back together. It's a trope, and this is no exception.
summary: Single mom ended up as assistant to the one man who got her pregnant... will she tell him about their son?

reviewText: ok

Then when she lands a job with his firm filling in as a temp for his regular PA, he practically forces her into sex within days....then proceeds to totally ignore her for weeks on end.

Stand up for yourself.

Lena Razzi had spent the last 3 years trying to forget Brice Henderson, now she stood there and couldn't  believe that he was  her boss. Brice Henderson, a wealthy and prosperous chemical engineer had left her as he wanted power and success and not tied down to a family life.

In the middle of his company closing a deal  seeing her was too much of a distraction. The last thing he needed was remembrance of his passion shared with Lena . Little did he know she had his son!

Romance instead of power and the need for someone that not only was beautiful,  but so caring, brought turmoil to Bruce. Would he continue his life without her?  Did he need this family issue to change his perfect life!  Great story, hard to put down.

Brice can't understand Lena's reluctance to continue the relationship. Lifelong hurts and stubborn wills make the temporary position a trial for all.

I kept flipping back pages to see if I had accidentally turned two at a time. I hadn't. Glad the book was free so i don't have to try returning it.

I don't think the h was a 'doormat' but she was weak, hoping to stand up for herself and failing most times. The H was arrogant and self-centered. He wasn't always like that but things from his past haunted him. We don't really get much of an explanation into his past, just a few lines, no big revelations where I think the author could have expanded and made things a big more dramatic and traumatic. The Epiphany is a bit lack luster. I wish the push and the pull between the H/h pulled on your heartstrings. I guess that just didn't happen for me. Will I continue with the series? Probably not.

I'm at lost as how to write this review without spoilers but Ill try my best not to. So.

One White Lie, the title alone makes you think of possibilities of what that title was about. Honestly though, Ive read quite a lot of novels with the same premise of story. When I got a hit after a few chapters what the one white lie is, I kind of wonder how the author will take such a plot that will make it different than the others. Not comparing authors, but one of the stories with almost the same story line that I loved was written by Melody Anne and deep inside I wished it wouldnt go the same way. And it did not. That part of the story was given justice very well and Id say the author was able to make the plot her own even though its been commonly used and almost a clich.

I was just a little disappointed with the lack of dialogues. I know narrations shape up the story. Its what give foundation and backbone to take a story where you want to lead it to. Its how you move forward. But for me, dialogues are the soul. Its what gives life to a good plot. And I even tried to scroll through out the whole book after I was done reading and I noticed there are chapters without a single dialogue in it. Thoughts by the characters narrated are good, it gives clarifications as to how a character is feeling at a certain point and gives justice to their actions. But I felt like there are a lot of scenes that would have gone better if the characters were at least talking to somebody even if they do not want to talk with each other.

I have grown to love Jeannette Winters novels but I cannot say that I enjoyed this one as much as I did her previous novels. But don't get me wrong, the story as a whole was still good even if I don't like the way it was written. And Id still definitely look forward to the next book in the series.

Jeannette Winters  Barrington Billionaires  One White Lie  book 1

Ms. Winters series is a SYNCHRONIZED series (all called: The Barrington Billionaires), with three authors. Each installment links each authors installment through certain characters and events. So, we have Jeannette, her sister Ruth Cardellos and niece Dannielle Stewart. Each author lovingly crafts a romance story that is compelling and you keep turning pages to find out what happens next. The Synchronized series is called The Barrington Billionaires. I would be missing a major component for a romance book and that is each author writes steamy hot passion and you may need to buy a fan.

In the first installment, we have already met Brice Henderson in Ms. Cardellos Always Mine.  He is Asher Barringtons partner and was the scientist half of the partnership. When Lena Razzi was offered an opportunity of a lifetime and she took the deal. Even if it meant she would have to work for Brice who had broken her heart into tiny pieces 3 years ago.

Brice is always working. He never taking time off.  If he has needs, he beds a woman that understands that there is nothing more than a physical relationship.  He traded everything for Power & Success. The newest deal that he and Asher had on the table would cement his spot at the TOP. Brice was given a new deadline by Asher and now he had to focus on his job and Lena working for him, even for 1 month, had the potential to lose that focus and that was not acceptable.

When Brice and Lena were even close to each other, their attraction had not waned at all.  Brice wanted to have a fling with no strings attached, but is that even possible. When Brice and Ashers company and employees may be at risk, Brice decides to take Lena to his home to protect her.

Will Brice and Lena have a second chance? Will he forgive her when he finds out there was a consequence to their love 3 years ago.  Has Brice even changed his mind about marriage and a family?  Find out.  You won't regret getting this wonderful story.
summary: Lena hasn't seen her first love in 3 years.  She has a secret and doesn't want Brice to find out. Wonderful Story, don't miss it

reviewText: Enjoyable start to a new series about Brice Henderson, a billionaire chemist and Lena Razzi, who is filling in at his office as his personal assistant temporarily.  Lena and Brice have a past and Lena has a very big white lie that she has been keeping from Brice.  Initially while reading this story I had a hard time liking Brice as he came off as incredibly selfish, unloving, self absorbed and was actually a real jacka##.  Lena on the other had was a very strong woman, loving, intelligent, but had been hurt by Brice on so many occasions yet still managed to keep it together.  Interestingly , characters were introduced to Lena from  both Ruth Cardello's billionaire and Ms. Winter's Barrington Billionaire  series at an event.  This was a really quick enjoyable read and my first from this author but certainly not my last.

summary: One White lie:Barrington  Billionaire's Series: Book One

reviewText:
One White Lie by Jeannette Winters

Brice Henderson wanted nothing but success for his company! He gave up everything and lets no one get in his way.

Lena Razzi has spent years trying to get over Brice and forget the pain he caused when he suddenly broke her heart. Once again she has found herself in his world and is at risk for another broken heart, especially when he finds out the secret she has kept from him.

Loved this story. This is my first read by Jeannette Winters and I loved it. The story is strong, well written and one of those cant put it down until the end kind of books. This is the first in a series, which also connects with Ruth Cardello, and Danelle Stewarts series, although each of these books can be read alone. I am looking forward to reading more books in this series.
Jeannette Winters its tops in writing about complicated characters with flaws that are unusual but whom we all know in our lives.  Brice and Lena are a couple you will love.

This book is a creative, whimsical collection of baby hats!  From rolled-brim to stocking, from ear flap to my favorite double-pointed hat--turning each page with a beautiful photo is like opening a gift!  The patterns are very clearly written and I could throw away some of my other instructional books, the sketches and words for many knitting basics are so well done and easy to follow.  A definite must have for every knitter!  I could even use some of these hats to decorate my house until I find a baby to give them to! I hope that this is the first of many books by Susan Anderson!
summary: Itty Bitty Baby Hats a thrilling new collection

reviewText: Fantastic in every way--this book is a must have for all knitters. Itty-Bitty Hats is bursting with creative ideas. Not only is it presented in an easy to follow manner, the text is entertaining and inspirational as well. So many ideas for so many many different hats of different shapes, colors, and styles. The only problem you might have is deciding which hat to make first--they are all darling beyond words. It is always a blessing when authors as talented as Susan share her ideas with the world.
I expected a number of different baby hats.  All I got was the same pattern over and over, with the only difference being the "decorations" that had to be created and attached to the hat!

The hat patterns in this book are the best!  The patterns are very easy to follow.  The photos in the book are beautiful, and the spiral binding is very helpful for knitters.  I hope Ms. Anderson will have many, many more books published.
summary: Wish I could give it more stars!

reviewText: Great selection of adorable hats - from the beginner knitter to the more experienced.  Highly recommended!
This book has the best collection of adorable hats I've ever seen. A must have!

i love this book! i have no babies to knit for specifically but hats are quick and easy, heartfelt gifts. there is such a terrific variety in this book from simple to sophisticated and all so very cute. i will be knitting some of these for Dulaan and other charitable efforts because the hats are budget and time friendly projects, who can resist such instant gratification? the book is really nicely printed too, quality paper, full color. and the spiral binding is the only way to present a book chock full of great patterns, not an insignficant detail to most knitters. a keeper for any knitting enthusiast looking to add to their reference library.
This book has fabulous hat creations for babies and kids.  The patterns are fun and look cute on kids.  The knitting instructions are easy to follow.  A must have for any knitting enthusiast.
Not impressed. Basic hat design
summary: Better baby hat books out there

reviewText: love this book and the price was great!
It has some cute hats I will be knitting up soon.
summary: It's a good one to have in your library for reference

reviewText: Transition to Icord of hat looks awkward.
Fun book with lots of cute patterns!
great patterns

This book is a wonderful resource, whether you are a brand new knitter on have years of experience! The patterns are unbelievably adorable and timeless.  They are written flawlessly and in a straight forward manner- there will be no confusion! And in a very short time, you will have the cutest baby/ toddler knit ever!

reviewText: Limited number of hats; kind of disappointing.
summary: Not a huge choice of styles.

reviewText: Great patterns for super cute hats!
Some of the pages stuck together and had pet hair inbetween pages
I love, love this book!  I have made many of the hats included and used the stitches I learned here on many other baby hats.
Did some itty-bitty hats for a hospital.
Great book.
Great baby hat book. Patterns easy to read.
Love the book
Best baby hats ever! This is a gift for a novice knitter!
Gave as a gift to a crocheter and she is very pleased.
I've made several of these hats and every one of them has turned out darling.  Great book.
Book in great shape. Contents were of the same style hat with different embellishments.
My wife loved this.
Great book with cute hat ideas!  Hats are easy to knit but adding just a few change ups will make the adorable!

Love this book, used it to knit 12 hats for my grand daughter before she was born, now she's two soon to be three and mom said need hats, so yep this book came out again, have it in hard cover and kindle , it's easy to use for any level knitter, plus she teaches you how to knit from beginner hats to experienced knitter hats. Go from begging to the end and you well be knitting hats of any kind for babies of children in not time.

Already made one adorable hat!
Love how Susan writes a pattern!
Love that this book is available in spiral!
Satisfied Customer!!!
Good book with cute hats!
Can't wait to start knitting from this book. Excellent photos and easy to understand directions. Now, I just need to grandchild to knit for! Highly recommend!
wonderful book, easy directions, definitions of stitches, how-tos, pictures, etc - highly recommend it to anyone who wants to make cute hats for the little ones!!
Very pleased withy his book. Have not tried any of the hats yet.. The book was in excellent condition. Clean
Great book but I was expecting a little more variety. Great product for the price though. Maybe it was just a little outdated for me

I was impressed by a note inside from the sender stating that they would promptly replace (if possible) if something offensive were found or if the contents were marred in any way so it didn't meet expectations.  And, this was for "used/like new" category.

I bought itty bitty toys before this book. I was really impressed with the toy designs, and so i wanted all her books. well i am just not that impressed with the hat designs for babies and toddlers. i will still probably make them but just thought the patterns would be better.
Made a couple of these little hats, but most were too busy for my taste.  Most had too much decoration. Directions are good.

I have a few of her books and patterns.  This book is responsible for teaching me how to make my first hat in the round.  She has very clear instructions and the patterns are always whimsical and creative.  Love it!

reviewText: I already made one of the little caps and it was very easy to follow the directions. I love the photos, too!
This is my number one, go to book for knitted baby hat patterns.  The instructions are clear and easy to follow, there is a wide variety of hats to choose from.
Look easy to make on the cover but they are actually complicated to knit for a baby. Lots of color changes so many ends to sew in.
a very cute knitting book for baby things. lots of ideas and do able projects even for a beginning knitter.

The Rainbow Marley is a hit with me.  It's a great stash buster and colors are easily adjusted for gender identification, if desired. The topper takes almost as long to knit as the hat, but worth the time and effort. I've made two already without spending an extra penny for yarn.  It works up well in cotton as well as wool and color combinations are so much fun to select. Take the author's advice to cast on and bind off tightly to make the topper curly.  My only complaint is that my book's pages are not consecutive - pages 49 through 64 were inserted after page 32.  Thankfully all pages are there, just not in the right order.
This book is delightful with its so many options for little hats-one to fit every occasion. I especially love the little birthday hat. Easy to read, great photos and beautiful baby models.
I make hats for babies and children for charity and as gifs and welcome the new patterns and ideas, Easy to follow directions and fun to make.
This book has some really great patterns, I love Susan Anderson's work.  Thanks for carrying her products.  Her other two books are good too - especially the nursery one.
I love to knit, and this book provides patterns to create many colorful knitted hats for babies and toddlers.  I can hardly wait to knit some of these hats.
Well written, easy to understand patterns. Easy enough for a beginner knitter.  A Good variety of patterns in the book.

Love this!  I have not knitted a project yet.
Have many picked out.  A very good baby hat book
Patterns for boys and girls

I recently started knitting again after a very long hiatus and was never much more than a basic knitter.  When several young friends and relatives recently had babies my friend loaned me this book of adorable hats.  To a beginner they may look a little complicated but are much easier to do than they look.  I've made five and am working on the sixth and decided I'd better just buy the book.  Now I'm looking for babies to knit for because the hats are so much  fun to make.

The beginning of the book covers materials and techniques in simple easy to follow steps and is very helpful.

I highly recommend this one!

If you like to knit and don't want long term projects and have children to knit for, this is a great book.  The directions are simple.  The hats come in numerous sizes.  They are all really cute and unique.  I recommend this book.
I don't know what's cuter the hats to make or the baby models!.  I have made 3 hats already.  Easy to hard!
This book is a lot of fun and the patterns are too! They are well  written and easy to follow.
This is a great book for beginners.  Some of the patterns are more advanced, so experienced knitters will love the book also.
My grandson received a hat knitted from this book, so I had to have the book.  These patters are so cute, easy to knit, and you can keep knitting year round for those unexpected gifts.
Wonderful tool! Knitting options abound and the pictures allow great glimpses of what can be. Recommend to anyone interested in caring for loved ones.
I have received many compliments on the hast that I have made both as presents and also hats that I have sold.
I have done several hat patterns in this book, easy to follow and clearly written.  I would recommend this book can be easily done by beginners as well as more experienced.
already was a fan of this author, this book koffers some great cute patterns and although I have not done every hat in the book they all are easy to follow and basic.

Had to buy a copy for myself, the hats were TOO CUTE!! If you are an experienced knitter, these hats will give you some ideas to be creative, a kind of template from which to build, suited to the personality of the one for whom you will be knitting...if you are not experienced, then you will gain some as you knit these projects. The book was worth the cost, to me.
summary: Initially saw this book at the local library

reviewText: There are maybe 2 cute hats in this entire book, and that's including the hat on the front cover of this book. These are the ugliest hats I've ever seen with crazy color combinations, oversized flowers and bunches of colorful worm looking I- Cords on top of these hats. Looks more like a clown show, nothing cute about it!
summary: The ugliest hats I've ever seen for a baby's head!

reviewText: My absolute favorite book.  I have made so many of the hats in this book.  Best purchase I good have made.

Itty-Bitty Hats has the cutest, easiest, and most stylish hats for babies. Young mothers like their babies dressed to the 10's. The patterns are knit in the round so they are beautifully constructed. There are hats for boys, girls, babies, & toddlers. It was a lot cheaper than at the knitting shop.

If you can't find something cute in this book, you are probably cranky and hate babies. These hats are so stinkin' cute I want to make all of them and lucky for me, I know some pregnant women due this winter. It doesn't get any better than that, folks. The patterns look easy enough for a beginner while being a fun and perhaps quick knit for more seasoned knitters.  Get this book, you will love it.

I was a brand new knitter when I bought this book, and was able to knit my first hat without any issues, and went on to knit other hats, and became a huge fan of all of Ms. Anderson's books.

She writes very clear instructions that are very easy to follow.  This book has sections about yarns and techniques, and really cute pictures.  Reading this book, and knitting along, almost makes you feel like you're knitting with a friend.

HIGHLY recommended!
I bought this book with the idea I would teach myself to knit. Love the book, pictures, styles, and descriptions... now just to teach myself to knit. Warmly
summary: Now just need to learn to knit!

reviewText: I wish more people would make knitting books like this. i have made almost every hat in this book., it is the best book i have and have ordered 3 copies of this book to give to friends . I wish there were more books like this one .HATS OFF TO THE AUTHOR !!!!!!!
This is a great book- fun fast projects, very do-able for beginners and it is a great reference book- the illustrations and directions are great.

This, and the birth of my first granddaughter, got me back into knitting after 25 years. The enticing photos and easy to follow directions sucked me into a reborn hobby.  One of the details i really found helpful was a list of skills necessary to do the project.  I've made about 6 hats from this book and have been very happy with the results.  If you're going to buy one baby hat book, this is the one, especially if you're a beginner.
I bought this baby knitting hat book for my mother.  She is the proud knitter and my new little granddaughter is the lucky recipient!  Both are totally pleased!
summary: Wonderful baby hat knitting book ... sure to please!

reviewText: As a beginning knitter I want some simple but cute patterns! This book is amazing. The patterns are simple to follow and the finished project is so adorable! I have now knitted 6 patterns from the book and look forward to making more! I highly recommend this book!

I am just learning to knit and this book is fabulous! East to follow, great picture and written instructions, and almost instant gratification! I can see me using this for many baby hats to come :) A must have for any knitter!
As with her other 2 books, this one is a hit. Easy to follow patterns with fun & quick results! A fun book to have. I wish I would have bought it sooner!
This book has lots of cute patterns that are fairly simple to make.  I would definitely recommend this book to others.

I am a new self taught knitter.  This book has been a wonderful knitting experience for me. I learned how to knit on double pointed needles with this book.  All the patterns are very clear and easy for a new knitter.  I have knitted half the hats in this book so far.  The hats are so cute everybody wants one.  Susan B Anderson has a blog: [...] and there is also a group on Ravelry [...] called Itty-Bitty Knits.  On both of these sites you can contact Susan with any questions.  She also has tutorials on her blog.  She is sweet, talented and very friendly.  If I could only recommend one book on knitting this would be the one.

Happy knitting!

Womanwithstixs
This is a great book for beginner to experienced knitters.  The designs are unique and fun.

I spotted this book on a table while in line to check out at a bookstore.  I picked it up and was inspired to start knitting again after a 5 year hiatus.  The technique explanations are just the ticket for beginners or those in need of a refresher (like me).  The designs are cute and interesting...also easily modifiable for the more advanced knitter.  I have made hats from this book for co-workers, family, and friends and they never fail to delight.  The "simple" caps are an incredibly quick knit and make wonderful donations to churches, charities, or hospital NICUs.  If you are looking for sweet little projects that give instant gratification, get this book.  (Bonus points for the layout and spiral binding!)

I purchased this book with only a few years of basic knitting under my belt.  I felt her patterns were VERY easy to follow and she gave very clear explanations.  There are MANY more girl patterns than boy but that is just the way it always is.  The projects are quick to finish as baby items always are and people will be AMAZED by your "skill".

Buy it - you'll fall in love with it.  And fall in love with your baby all over again by these cute hats on top of their precious heads!
I have made many of the items and also love Susan's blog! Between the two I have figured it all out! I love all the cute designs!!
summary: I love it!! It was like a teacher in a book!! :)

reviewText: I fell in love with this book before I learned to knit!  Once I learned, I had to buy the book.  Exceptionally detailed instructions make every hat easy to make.

I love this book!  The patterns are easy to follow and there's very few errors.  There's a nice "how to" section if you're a new knitter or need a refresher on some different techniques.  I've made several of the hats in the book, both for my kids and as gifts.  They always turn out just like the picture, are the size they're intended to be, and most importantly, are practical for young kids.  The hats got comments from people every time my kids wore them, and I even had people ask me to make some for their kids.  There's also a nice variety, from the very simple, to really decorative.  There's even a lot of cute choices for boys, which can be hard to find.  My only wish is there would be instructions for making the hats for adults!
These hats are so cute and get oh's and ahh's at every shower! so cute and great quick projects!

This book is great for beginning knitters and includes many variations on a couple different patterns.  I've made several of these hats and didn't use the yarns she listed but they turned out just as well.  I like having this book as a go to when I need to whip up a baby gift real quick.  If you're looking for something really challenging this isn't for you.
We love this little book.  It has a marvelous collection of hats that are a pleasure to knit.  We've had a lot of fun with this.

Easy-to-use, complete & clear directions, cute & original designs. I use this book to make baby caps for "Newborns in Need" because they go quickly, but still allow me to make some different and creative head-wear for these itty-bitty girls and guys. Photos are great. These are very, very simple -- a good thing for some purposes, potentially a minor disappointment for others.
This book is full of cute baby hats, the directions are clear and the projects make me anxious for the next baby shower invitation!

Absolutely love this book, I have 3 small grandchildren and lots of little friends! I have loved knitting all these hats!  I am on hat number 12!!! I am addicted and cannnot stop!  BUT if you bought this book you will also want to buy Itty Bitty Nursery!!!  Susan Anderson is awesome and full of wonderful ideas for little ones!!!!!!

I found this in my local library and decided I had to buy it...

The author starts with a very basic/simple beanie pattern on circular/double pointed needles (no seams!) and then shows variations.

The wool is mostly Rowan cottons however beanies are quite forgiving and many wools work just as well if you watch your tension square; I have knitted the dropped-daisy in a fluffy wool, and a striped beanie in a light pure wool.

What I would like to know before buying this book:
It is a US book - US tension gauge, inches and US needle sizes.
The patterns are beginner to intermediate - there is nothing inately difficult or challenging with these patterns.
The patterns are (mostly) in sizes newborn to 2yrs+.  Nothing bigger.
Most of the pattern variations are made with colour changes and toppers.
The pictures are gorgeous and the patterns work!
There are a few errors in the patterns that are pretty easy to work around, and with minor modifications you can vary the final look to your own taste, eg the dropped daisy hat in many on the customer images has quite small petals and a very long stem (by pattern) but can be easily changed to suit yourself.
There are quite a few patterns; I would make most of them, and have made 5 of them in the last 4 weeks.

Addendum: I made the dropped daisy hat in a soft pink wool with a lemon daisy for my 2+ yo.  First off, she refuses to remove it - it goes on when she gets up and comes off only to sleep.  Secondly it was easy to make but looks so effective.  And thirdly, we get compliments everywhere we go.  I have never had this happen before - everyone we meet says "gorgeous hat", "love the hat", etc.  What more can you want?  This book was worth the buy, if only for that one pattern.
summary: A simple pattern with lovely variations

reviewText: For beginners, I would definitely recommend to buy this book before diving into the Itty Bitty Nursery as the author explains all the basic skills and supplies needed to complete the projects.  Clear instructions along with video from Susan Anderson's Blog.  The spiral-bound book helps keep the pages open so you can refer back while you knit your project.  The hats are so adorable and knit up quickly (thank goodness babies are small).  They make great gifts. I know some experienced knitters have found the projects boring, but I thought the designs were very inspirational.
summary: Great for Beginners, Inspirational for the more experienced

reviewText: This is one of the first books I bought when I was teaching myself to knit.  It's great!  The explains everything very well...with pictures.  Plus the fact that I have a grandchild I am knitting for was a bonus.  We also use this book to knit for childrens hospital. It's also great for creativity.
Same basic hat throughout, but with a lot of choices to dress it up or keep it simple. Babies are gonna love these hats! Moms and Grannies are going to enjoy making them.

I just received my book a few days ago, but I cannot wait to get started. This is an absolutely adorable book.  It is very detailed, very well written and easy to understand.  There are tons of helpful techniques and instructions included.

This book is filled with adorable hats to make for babies and toddlers.  I love how she uses embellishments, textures, and colors to make these cute hats.  You won't need another baby hat book ever!  If you get Itty Bitty Nursery as well, you'll be set.  What a fun book!
summary: Susan Anderson if the Queen of Cute!

reviewText: this book has some of the cutest hats I have ever seen.  It has a super cute beginner pattern, as well as some more complicated hats.  There are also really good instructions to get you started.  I can't wait to make all of the hats.

This is without a doubt the best source for knitting baby hats.  The ideas are just adorable, and the instructions, even for beginners are so well laid out and documented, this could be an instruction book as well.  I've personally made the basic hat, the olive you hat, the upside down flower hat and variations on a few more.  My friends keep trying to steal this from me.  I hear Itty Bitty Hats 2 is out and I MUST have it!

Got this for my mom who is a novice knitter.  She LOVED the designs but is having a difficult time following the instructions (she's better at learning by doing than learning things by the book).  Probably not a problem for somebody with more experience knitting.  I have a friend who bought this book as well and has made some really cute hats that look great.  There are a number of pages in the front that explain basic knitting techniques which I imagine would be useful to a beginner.
summary: Really cute designs, but hard for a novice

reviewText: I think this is a GREAT book!  I have NEVER knit before, but I am 9 months pregnant and bored...so I picked up a new hobby.  This book has wonderful instructions at the beginning for the "total newbie". I was able to knit my way to a cute hat in 2 days.  I am not sure how I would feel about it if I were an "experienced knitter" but the hats are adorable no matter what!

I saw this book at a local bookstore and was so captivated by the cover that I ended up buying it--and then bought needles and yarn, and learned to knit!  The instructions and illustrations are easy enough for a novice, and the variations on similar themes make it easy to progress from the simpler hats to the more detailed ones.  I made the "Ribbons" hat for a friend's baby shower, and it was the hit of the party.  Wherever my daughter wears any of her Itty Bitty Hats (I've made her several), she turns heads.  The hats are adorable, and the book is beautiful.  I can't wait to buy Susan's next one!
summary: So Cute I Bought It and Learned To Knit!

reviewText: I got this book as a present and have knit 5 of the hats so far. I think it is fun and all the patterns are doable if you have a working knowledge of knitting.

I bought this book having never picked up knitting needles and learned how to make these hats by the authors instruction!  A 4th of the book is teaching knitting so I don't know if experienced knitters would like that, but even then, it has a lot of cute baby hat instructions!  Only twice did I have to use my computer to supplement her instructions, and only b/c I needed to SEE the stitch done so I found a video online.  I'm on my 2nd hat for my newborn coming this fall and find this book very user-friendly and easy to follow!
summary: A beginner who LOVES this book!

reviewText:
Great book with clear and complete instructions.  Wisely starts with a very simple hat and leads you gradually to more complicated designs.
You can make an unique baby gift in an afternoon or two.
Highly recommend for the novice and experienced knitter.

This book delivers a wonderful collection of gorgeous children's hats.  I am very pleased to have this in my knitting book collection, and have already planned some of the projects as presents.  Clear instructions, beautiful large colour photos.  I love it.

I bought this book for one pattern, but once it arrived and I saw all the adorable hats in it, I have made 4 different ones as well!  One of the best things about the book is that all the patterns use the same size needles and the same weight yarn, so you can buy enough for one hat, but have leftover yarn to create a different one as well.  The patterns are easy to follow...a great book to have in your stash!

The patterns in this book are very well written and easy to follow. The hats all very capable for a beginner to intermediate knitter. I have made two hats from this book and both were made true to their size description. I enjoyed the detailed information in the beginning, giving tips and guidelines that the author wished she had known starting out.

Best thing is that the patterns I made were exactly as shown in the picture and the sizes were true to description (6-12 month size is truley that size).

This has got to be the best baby hat book I have seen!  These hats are adorable and so easy to do!  I am a new knitter and have only done scarves, felted purses and some easy rolled brim hats.  But I can say that I will make every one of these!  The directions are so easy to follow and the photographs are awesome!  I hope Susan makes a Itty Bitty Hats II!

This is a great book, even for the beginning knitter.  Directions are clear and understandable and all the photographs are truly inspiring.  Whether you are creating an exact replica, or adding a little flair of your own, the designs are easy to follow and knit up quickly.  Definitely pick up this book if you are expecting...or know someone who is expecting and would appreciate some handknits!

This little book has been SO MUCH FUN!!!! It is written well and very concise. I haven't found any misunderstandings or mistakes so far and the finished projects are just adorable. I would recommend this for anyone, accomplished knitter or beginner.

This is the nicest illustrated book and the hats are just adorable! If you have any desire to knit or crochet little baby hats, this is the book for you!

Patricia Gribble

I found this book disappointing. The first 54 pages were learning how to knit and do the embroidery. Most of the designs are rather simple hats with cute decorations added. 3 basic hats using dk, worsted and heavy worsted yarns. Good purchase if you think the hats are cute although I didn't care for most of them. I like the spiral binding and the babies are quite cute.

I've knit two hats out of this book. The hats are very cute although mostly they are variations on one or two themes. One of the nice things about this book is that the author uses the same yarns for most of the hats. This allows you to knit more than one style hat with the same yarn if you have some leftovers.

However, if you are a very experienced knitter who is looking for variety... this is not for you. I would definitely get this as a gift for my friends who are just learning to knit. The instructions at the beginning are good and since the hats are similar and use the same yarn, a beginner would get lots of practice.

the hats in it are cute.  i haven't made any yet myself, but a friend did and it is too cute.  i would venture to make the  hats larger for bigger people to wear, some of the hats i wouldn't mind wearing myself.
summary: itty bitty hats by susan b anderson

reviewText: I don't care if you have babies in your life or not -- after you see these adorable patterns, you'll be knitting these hats for your dogs, cats, and babies you see on the street! The hats are whimsical, fun, and unexpected -- and totally cute. LOVE IT.
summary: A Great Addition to your Knitting Library

reviewText: I absolutely love this book!  The patterns are so easy and so creative!  It is so refreshing to see so many adorable, creative patterns in one book.  Many times knitting books have one or two good patterns and the rest are so-so.  In this book, every single pattern is easy, creative and fun.  I have already given two of the hats to a new niece and nephew. The  moms loved the gift and have told me about all the compliments that they are getting.  The photos are wonderful.  I love the fact that each hat has its own little unique fun thing about the pattern.  This is a great holiday present for any knitter on your list!!!!!

Wow this is an awesome book, I've already made six hats from here and I'm still going!!  Every pattern has newborn through toddler sizes and the first three are plain hats in three weights of yarn which can then be applied to any other hats if you'd like to change the weight.  They have patterns with color, texture, crazy and just plain pretty... it's perfect for any baby you could ever need to knit for!!  I'd recommend this to every knitter!!

This is a great book of children's hat patterns.  They are quite easy to make even for the beginning knitter.  They range from sizes 0 to 3 months to toddler.  The author demonstrates nicely how to do all the stitches required for each hat in a special section of the book.  She also shows how to make many fun toppers for the hats.  These are great hats and get quite a lot of attention when the child wears them.  Fun hats and great book!
cute tags, especially helpful for a multi-cultural class.
Great for a meeting for several child care centers in the inner city.
Great school tool!

the name tags worked well, we are all older but feel young.  Were used for our 50 th high school reunion and everyone loved them. the only complaint was they came loose due to the glue not being sticky enough.

I love these stickers!!!  Even better, so did the children I used them for.  I run parties for children in a shelter and anything that's cheery and bright is a welcome addition.  We use name tags at our parties and, rather than the standard "hello My Name Is" stickers, these were great.  And they stay on!!

I rarely use them for name tags but do sometimes when needed for children.  Would also be good to use for a school reunion of adults.  They're cute and colorful and I use them mainly as bookplates.  Teachers should be able to use them in many creative ways.
Love the cuteness of the kids on these and that they show the diversity of the children. I'm ordering another pack to have on hand.

It was in February, in Buffalo, so yes it was a blizzard.  So I was out on a lunch break, working night shift at 2am, when a squad car pulls up and the cop gets out, telling me to stop and come over.  He asks, "What's with the ski mask?"  And I don't think I have to explain why I would be wearing a ski mask in a blizzard, so I just put my hands out, indicating the snow that was everywhere.

He seemed to get the picture, but then said, "Well, we got a call."  (Which is a blanket excuse to harass people)  "Could you at least show me your face?"  So, I pulled up the skimask, showing my friendly face, as a courtesy.  Then he asks for my ID, and I respectfully refuse.  (As is my right, legally and in general)  I explain to him that I have no legal obligation to show my ID.

But then he goes off on a lecture about "Well, in today's world--blah, blah, blah", he of course mentions 9/11 and any other excuse he can remember from the rotten cop handbook, and I already know how to respond to this crap, so I'm just waiting for him to stop moving his stupid mouth.  When he finally does, I tell him straight out:  "Today's world is FREEZING.  So I'm wearing a skimask.  Am I being detained, or are we done here?"  (That question is paramount when dealing with police)

And as if I'd shown him a federal badge, his whole posture changes, he lowers his head and waves me off, "Have a nice night."  And that was it.

I know this story has little to do with reviewing the skimask itself, but I felt I'd said enough when selecting five stars and "Fit as expected".  I'm simply getting this little moment off my chest, as I'm kinda proud of it.  These are the times where we need to show the machine who the human is.
summary: Fit so well, I was harassed by the police, in a blizzard!

reviewText:
As someone who's not exactly skinny, I am not the kind of person who would normally buy something online. This dress is SO comfortable, and perfect for pregnancy and nursing. The number one thing you want to know when you're nursing is 'can I get my boobs out quickly'?? And this is such a cool dress and it's got the easy access.

I ordered an XL because I usually wear XL shirts and it's comfy for me and fits perfectly. The pictures aren't the most flattering that I'm posting with this, but I will be wearing this to parties and weddings even because I can get my daughter fed right away when she needs it, and it's a way to be dressy without feeling uncomfortable. I love that I can tie it either in the front or the back, if I tie in the front it hangs down the front and if you tie it in the back it's got a much shorter hanging part. Either way, I think it's really pretty.

The dress itself is soft and the color is beautiful (the lighting in my basement is fluorescent so it's not what you would call great for pictures) but it's actually a really deep purple that looks great with my skin tone. I am hoping to be pregnant soon and I know this will be a perfect way to keep myself comfortable when we may feel our most uncomfortable ever. *I received this product at a discount in exchange for my honest and unbiased review.
summary: Best dress I've ever bought online and it's wonderful for nursing in!

reviewText:
This is a very nice dress, good quality.  The fabric is super soft and it drapes nicely on the body.  It has an almost silky feel to it. The hem of the skirt is well made and double stitched and it hits just below the knee making it perfect for summer. The color isn't the greatest, it would be nicer if it was a deeper saturation to the green, to me it looks more grey than olive but it's still very nice.  It fits as expected, is loose and generous with the fabric around the waist and in the chest area.  Nursing mothers will find this dress allows for easy access and you can use the wrap portion of the dress to discreetly hold the baby as well.

Even if you aren't nursing, this is a loose, flowing dress that is flattering on all figures for the summer.  You can tie the dress in front in different ways too for different looks.  Overall this dress meets my expectations and is well made.  I'd be glad to recommend it to others.  My only complaint really is the depth of color is lacking, aside from that it's great.

I received this item at a discount in exchange for testing and a fair and honest review.
summary: Love the feel of this fabric - very nice.

I love that the tie around covers the nursing holes- I have other shirts with nursing holes that I have to watch out for or else I'll hang out of them. The waist is highly adjustable. The neckline keeps my cleavage covered. No problems after washing. I wanted to buy more in other colors, but I'm disappointed that the price has increased since my purchase. It's still worth it. The only negative (other than the price increase) is that you can't put this dress back on with one hand. I had to hand my baby off to get re-situated, but it's worth it to have such a well-designed access area!
All that I wanted a comfortable dress to breastfeed!
Love it. A little on the long side since I'm only 5-2 but I like things long.

I bought this top in hot pink, and loved it so much I bought another in purple. The fabric is soft and thick, not see-through, but very breathable. I am 5'6", and 212 lbs at 22 weeks pregnant, and I bought an XL. It is very flattering and I get a lot of compliments on this top. I may by it in yet another color!
summary: Great maternity shirt for curvy women

reviewText: I really like this shirt! It did shrink a little bit.

I am currently 35 weeks pregnant, and this shirt looks great!  I hope it looks this good postpartum (fit wise, and length).  The nursing slits will be very easy to use for breastfeeding.  The material is like a heavier t-shirt material, and the tie can be done three different ways (front, side and back...all very cute).  I read some reviews that complained about wrinkles.  Mine arrived without many wrinkles, so I am hopeful that wrinkles will not be an issue.  Size info:  I was 5'4" and 120 lbs prepregnancy, and I am currently 145 lbs at 35 weeks pregnant.  The small fits me very well.  I would not want it any larger.  So, I would say that if you are between sizes you should size down based on the size chart given.
It was a little large, but it still looks good in general. Pretty flattering on a post-pregnancy body even when it is slightly large.
summary: A little large, but still looks good.

reviewText: Love this top!!  Great quality for the price. I'm 5'8", 160ish pre-pregnancy and busty, the XL is perfect.  I could wear a L, but I like the XL for length so I can wear it with leggings.  Olive is a great neutral color.  Figure and bump flattering.
This would be a good pregnancy then nursing shirt because it is longer in the front than in the back. I am post pregnancy so I personally would prefer the shirt not be so long in the front.

reviewText: I am 5'2" and 177 lbs. I just gave birth last week. The shirt fits well, however I found it a tad bit small on my back. I do not like things to cling to me in my bra strap area. reviewText: My favorite nursing shirt. So soft and yet looks really cute with jeans or leggings.

This is a really great, versatile dress. I love to wear dresses, but it's so hard to find modest dresses that are also nursing-friendly. This dress is perfect! I also love that it will work as a maternity dress too (but isn't obnoxiously long while I'm not pregnant). Definitely get this dress if you're nursing and plan to have more children!
Amazing dress! The dress is knee length, doesn't hug, and is very comfy. I am very pleased! It hides my postpartum belly well and has easy access for nursing. It was exactly what I was looking for!

I was looking for a professional enough dress to wear to the office and still be able to pump/nurse. This fits so well! I've had veteran moms ask me where I got it, too. I was so pleased that I ordered another about a week later. I wish they came in a few more colors! Also, I find it looks most professional tied in the back.
Love it

Great buy and I'll most likely buy it in different colors. Haven't breastfed with it yet, but I remember breastfeeding with my first and shirts like this were awesome.

reviewText: This is my favorite nursing top.  It gives enough access and privacy to nurse.  I also often need to pump one breast while feeding from another and this top allows me to easily do that. reviewText: I liked this dress so much that I ordered 3 - black, grey, and purple. They are comfortable, yet suitable for going back to the office postpartum. Easy to feed baby when home and pump while away from him. I'm 5 foot and my only complaint is that it's a bit long, but they can be hemmed so no worries.

I'm pregnant with my second and ordered this to have another sunset pregnancy dress that could transition to a nursing dress. I am so thrilled with it! It fits well and looks great, and the nursing coverage is awesome, with openings in just the right spot to access what's needed without baring it all. I could easily see this being used without a nursing cover, as you also have extra fabric for the wrap part that you could use it you felt any area was too exposed. All around great purchase; I'm buying at least one more. I just wish there were more colors!
summary: Best nursing dress I've ever owned!

reviewText:
I bought three of these dresses in Medium: black, olive, and purple. They're super comfortable and work for church or running errands. I'm 24 weeks pregnant and didn't want to spend too much on maternity clothes -- especially since I hope to nurse for longer than I'll be pregnant.
Since I'm not nursing yet, the most I can say is that this dress has a nicer design than I anticipated. The side seams of the nursing windows overlap, so the tie-front is for added modesty and ease of use, not to cover up an embarrassing exposure.

Love this! So comfortable and versatile. Have gotten lots of compliments. Please make more products! I have both the dress and the shirt in mulitple colors and every time I wear one, I get loads of compliments.
summary: Awesome maternity and nursing dress! A definite staple!

reviewText: Very comfortable and easy to nurse in! I ordered this after buying 3 of these tops for pregnancy/nursing and they are some of my favorites! The fabric is very soft and the colors are pretty. Only small negative is that it is a lot of fabric and can be warm on very hot days. However, it can be difficult to find dresses that are easy to nurse in, so this is a great item to have in the wardrobe!

This dress is very soft and fits nicely.  I am about 5'11 and it comes down to my knees.  The neckline is also high.  It's great if you want everything covered and secure. I've washed it about 3 times and it still looks nice.  It's a heavy dress, which is good because it's not see through, but warm for the summer weather.  I bought it because I needed a nursing dress to wear to a funeral.  I'm 28 years old and I wouldn't say the dress is "cute", rather that it is functional and well-made.
This would be perfect if I bought a smaller size. Super comfy. I like that I'm covered up and it's versatile.

***** UPDATE *****
I have had three shirts (grey, pink, black) and two of these dresses (olive, purple) for nearly a year now, and they all have held up fairly well.  Some, I have found, are different fabrics--the grey shirt is thicker than the pink and black colored shirts.  Additionally, two of them (the grey and pink ones) are starting to pill a bit.  That being said, they have generally held up very well in the wash (and the dryer...).  A few reviewers said they were too heavy for summer/hot-weather wear.  I would agree.  I currently live on a tropical island and the shirts are just too heavy (or too much fabric?) to wear outside in the heat & humidity.  The dresses breathe a bit more though, and I can go outside in them... as long as I am OK with sweat showing through.  The shirts are very long and if I wasn't planning to hand these down to my sisters when they get pregnant, I would have gotten them tailored to be MUCH shorter--now that I'm at my pre-pregnancy weight the only thing the shirts look good with are leggings/yoga pants.

ORIGINAL REVIEW:

I love this dress! I bought it after buying and loving a few of the shirts produced by the same company.  The purple color is as shown in the pictures online.  The fabric is a touch thin, but holds up well in the washer/dryer and I haven't noticed any shrinkage.  For sizing purposes, I am 5'9" and 150 lbs post-pregnancy and the size small fits perfectly (if anything, it's a touch big).  When I get back to my pre-pregnancy weight of 135, I'm sure the dress will still fit very well based on the cut and the ability to cinch it with the tying ends.

The ONLY downside is that because this is a pregnancy dress, the front of the dress is cut longer than the back.  Thus, if you are in your third trimester, the bottom of the dress hem will be perfectly even and parallel to the ground... not so much when you no longer have the baby bump!

This dress is soft and light; the color (purple) is a bit dark but it hides the post-partum belly nicely with the empire waist. I would prefer less fabric in the front, seeing as I am no longer pregnant. But I appreciate dual purpose clothes and the material hangs very flat for a maternity dress. The nursing access panels are perfect for me since I dislike low cut tops- I don't have to yank down on an already low v- neck to nurse my baby
Great shirt, soft, easy to nurse in. I purchased a second!
Really heavy material
Love this top!  Great style and very easy to nurse in.
Allows nursing to be so much easier
Flattering and soft and pretty

reviewText: Like the material and functions as advertised.

The top fits great, the bottom part is not too tight, still a little loose and flowy. Looks GREAT. I can wear this for the remainder of my pregnancy, and afterwards. I might even have to go down to a small after I drop some of the pregnancy stomach, we'll see. Definitely expect it to be on the big size. But it's incredibly comfortable and I think it will be great for breastfeeding!

Great top for nursing! I love the ease of being able to untie and discreetly feed my baby through the side slit without having to pull up or push down my clothing.

For sizing follow the bust, waist, shoulder measurements. According to this size chart's measurements, I should have chosen the small, but I thought it would be too small. I'm generally a size 6-8 in clothing and chose the large based on that, but it is too big. With the tie front, I am able to tighten to fit, so it isn't a major issue. If I were purchasing another one, I'd go with a small.
summary: Great top for nursing! Follow the listed measurements for the best fit.

reviewText: I love this shirt! I was struggling for weeks to find a nursing top that is not only cute and practical but one that also fits my chest. This one not only is all of those things but it's extremely comfy! I plan on buying more colors!
Love it!  It's cute and great for breastfeeding.
summary: Love it! It's cute and great for breastfeeding

reviewText: It's nice but way too long.

Thank you! Thank you! Thank you to the designer and makers of this dress!  I am a big busted nursing mother (bra size 38G), and I am very conservative and religious. Because of my big bust size, it is so difficult to find a MODEST and nice fitting nursing dress.  Either the dress is too tight around my bust and my cleavage shows (definitely unacceptable) or the dress fits my bust but then hangs like a tent on me. So I'm stuck wearing skirts with tops. This dress makes nursing modest also. The colors are beautiful. I bought the dress in 4 different colors.  You will feel feminine, modest, comfortable, and beautiful in this dress!  For reference, I am 5' 4" and 165 lbs.  I bought size large, and it fits perfectly.

reviewText: I love this dress!! I immediately ordered another color and two of the shirts after trying it on. It fits true to size, it's loose enough to camouflage a squishy postpartum belly, but is still flattering. I love the different options you have with the sash. The nursing access is easy, I had no problems feeding my baby in this dress. I usually don't care too much about covering up, but dresses are often hard to breastfeed in without having to pull the whole thing up or pull the entire top down. I would LOVE a maxi dress like this and also a sleeveless version, but I'm definitely going to be wearing these dresses all summer!
It was just as expected! Perfect fit.

reviewText:
I just received this dress. It arrived in the time promised in good condition. The dress is amazinging soft and comfortable.

I am still pregnant and it fits well and true to sizing. I tried tying it in the front and back and I think to make me feel like I have some shape I prefer tying in the back but would most likely tie in the front while nursing for easier access.

One of the nicest parts is that it has truly easy access for nursing but does not look like a nursing dress!  I feel like I am walking around in a comfortable yet beautiful, flattering and useful dress!

reviewText:
I purchased this for our daughter, she is expecting her first child, our first grandchild, in the next few months.

The dress is washer and dryer safe. The dress fits to size, and is flattering on all figures.
For the price this a very nice quality dress, my daughter said she would recommend it to others.

Beautiful shirt. Love it. I'm 5.6 and 155lbs with 38D's fit great just a little long but trying to get pregnant so it will be worn a lot. Very soft comfortable material just wish it was a little cheaper.

Bought this to bring to hospital to wear for professional in room photos. Love this shirt!! Looked great in photos and hid residual baby weight. Could wear during or after pregnancy. Great material and stylish. Can wear with jeans or leggings. A little expensive but I think it was worth the price.
Love love love this shirt! Great quality, washes up nice, and doesn't wrinkle.  I do a lot of traveling and always wear this shirt on flights for breastfeeding.
Love this
